question: In the titration of potassium permanganate (KMnO4) against Ferrous ammonium sulphate (FAS) solution, dilute sulphuric acid but not nitric acid is used to maintain acidic medium, because
choices: It is difficult to identify the end point
Nitric acid doesn't act as an indicator
Nitric acid itself is an oxidizing agent
Nitric acid is a weak acid than sulphuric acid
explanation: Nitric acid is a strong oxidising agent and would interfere with the redox titration by reacting with the reducing agent (FAS) itself [cite: 684-692].
